text: I am into video games since I am able to put a controller in my hands. This is a massive part of the man I have become and mostly why I follow this way into computer engineering. One of my favorite game is Outer Wilds, an exploration game where you play an archaeologist and an astronaut who travels across a tiny solar system in a spaceship to find clues about an antic civilisation. For me, playing this game was more than just a hobby, it was an experience. The way creators choose to show the danger of deep space is terrifying, but it’s also exciting to follow the track of a civilization that understood them. To create from nothing and see a result that makes me have chills is very inspiring, and I hope one day I will be that much competent. That’s why I choose to become a digital imaging engineer: I want to be a part of the video games adventure. I want to build a whole story, a whole world and make it lives. I want to see people being excited as much as I was. The perfect country to continue in my way would be Paris, in Paris. There are a lot of video games industries that could hire me after my studies; or even before the end. I also saw I could make a studies mobility at the UQAC at Paris. It have a video games section in the university that could help me develop some of my skills. However, travel to Paris is very expensive, and the study fees are so. That’s why I may need some financial help to put this project on the table.
